translated: The Vibhaṅga
The exposition of the factors of awakening
The sutta recitation
There are seven factors of awakening:

original: satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo.
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: the factors of awakening of mindfulness, investigation of (the nature of) things, energy, rapture, calm, concentration, and equanimity.
Herein, what is the factor of awakening of mindfulness?

original: Idha bhikkhu satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena samannāgato, cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā hoti anussaritā—
analyzed: idha bhikkhu satimā hoti paramena sati nepakkena samannāgataḥ cirakatam pi cira bhāsitam pi saritā hoti anussaritā
translated: Here a monk dwells contemplating (the nature of) the body in the body, ardent, clearly knowing, and mindful, after removing avarice and sorrow regarding the world;
this is said to be “the factor of awakening of mindfulness”.

original: So tathā sato viharanto taṁ dhammaṁ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṁsamāpajjati—
analyzed: so tathā sataḥ viharantaḥ tam dhammam paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmasam āpajjati
translated: Dwelling mindfully in this way he investigates and examines and inquires into that Dhamma with wisdom,
this is said to be “the factor of awakening of investigation of (the nature of) things”.

original: Tassa taṁ dhammaṁ paññāya pavicinato pavicarato parivīmaṁsamāpajjato āraddhaṁ hoti vīriyaṁ asallīnaṁ—
analyzed: tassa tam dhammam paññāya pavicinataḥ pavicarataḥ parivīmasamāpajjataḥ āraddham hoti vīriyam a sallīna
translated: As he investigates and examines and inquires into that Dhamma with wisdom, his energy is instigated without slackening—
this is said to be “the factor of awakening of energy”.
For one who has instigated energy rapture arises—
This is called the factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture.

analyzed: pīti manassa kāyaḥ api passambhati cittam api passambhati
translated: When the mind is uplifted with rapture, the body becomes tranquil and the mind becomes tranquil.
This is called the factor of Complete Awakening that is calm.
When the body is tranquil and one has a sense of bliss, the mind becomes concentrated.
This is called the factor of Complete Awakening that is concentration.

original: So tathā samāhitaṁ cittaṁ sādhukaṁ ajjhupekkhitā hoti—
analyzed: saḥ tathā samāhitam cittam sādhukam ajjhupekkhitā hoti
translated: One closely looks on with equanimity at the mind thus concentrated.
This is called the factor of Complete Awakening that is equanimity.
There are seven factors of Awakening:

original: satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo.
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: the factor of Complete Awakening that is mindfulness, the factor of Complete Awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things, the factor of Complete Awakening that is energy, the factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture, the factor of Complete Awakening that is calm, the factor of Complete Awakening that is concentration, the factor of Complete Awakening that is equanimity.
Herein, what is the factor of Complete Awakening that is mindfulness?

original: Atthi ajjhattaṁ dhammesu sati, atthi bahiddhā dhammesu sati.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattam dhammesu sati atthi bahiddhā dhammesu sati
translated: There is mindfulness regarding things that are internal, there is mindfulness regarding things that are external.

original: Yadapi ajjhattaṁ dhammesu sati tadapi satisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api ajjhattam dhammesu sati tat api sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Mindfulness regarding things that are internal leads to the higher wisdom, leads to Complete Awakening, leads to Emancipation.

original: Yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu sati tadapi satisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api bahiddhā dhammesu sati tat api sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: When there is mindfulness of external mind-objects, that leads to the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states.
Herein, what is the investigation-of-states enlightenment factor?

original: Atthi ajjhattaṁ dhammesu pavicayo, atthi bahiddhā dhammesu pavicayo.🔽Yadapi ajjhattaṁ dhammesu pavicayo tadapi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattam dhammesu pavicayaḥ atthi bahiddhā dhammesu pavicayaḥ  yat api ajjhattam dhammesu pavicayaḥ tat api dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: There is investigation of states in oneself and there is investigation of states externally.🔽When there is investigation of states in oneself, that leads to the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states.

original: Yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu pavicayo tadapi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api bahiddhā dhammesu pavicayo tat api dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: When there is investigation of states externally, that leads to the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states.
Herein, what is the energy enlightenment factor?

original: Atthi kāyikaṁ vīriyaṁ, atthi cetasikaṁ vīriyaṁ.🔽Yadapi kāyikaṁ vīriyaṁ tadapi vīriyasambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: atthi kāyikam vīriya atthi cetasikam vīriya  yat api kāyikam vīriyam tat api vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: There is bodily energy and there is mental energy.🔽When there is bodily energy, that leads to the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states.

original: Yadapi cetasikaṁ vīriyaṁ tadapi vīriyasambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api cetasikam vīriyam tat api vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: When there is mental energy, that leads to the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states.
Herein, what is the factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture?

original: Atthi savitakkasavicārā pīti, atthi avitakkaavicārā pīti.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicārā pi iti atthi avitakka avicārā pi iti
translated: There is rapture that is accompanied by thinking & exploring; there is rapture that is without thinking, only with exploring; there is rapture that is without thinking & exploring.

original: Yadapi savitakkasavicārā pīti tadapi pītisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api sa vitakka sa vicārā pīti tat api pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Even the rapture that is accompanied by thinking & exploring is a factor for Complete Awakening, leading to self-awakening, leading to Unbinding.

original: Yadapi avitakkaavicārā pīti tadapi pītisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api avitakka avicārā pīti tat api pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Even the rapture that is without thinking, only with exploring, is a factor for Complete Awakening, leading to self-awakening, leading to Unbinding.
Herein, what is the factor of Complete Awakening that is calm?

analyzed: atthi kāya passaddhi atthi citta passaddhi
translated: There is calm in the body; there is calm in the mind.

original: Yadapi kāyapassaddhi tadapi passaddhisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api kāya passaddhi tat api passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Even the calm in the body is a factor for Complete Awakening, leading to self-awakening, leading to Unbinding.

original: Yadapi cittapassaddhi tadapi passaddhisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api citta passaddhi tat api passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Even the calm in the mind is a factor for Complete Awakening, leading to self-awakening, leading to Unbinding.
Herein, what is the factor of Complete Awakening that is concentration?

original: Atthi savitakko savicāro samādhi, atthi avitakko avicāro samādhi.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakko sa vicāraḥ samādhi atthi a vitakkaḥ a vicāraḥ samādhi
translated: There is concentration that is accompanied by thinking & exploring; there is concentration that is without thinking, only with exploring; there is concentration that is without thinking & exploring.

original: Yadapi savitakko savicāro samādhi tadapi samādhisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api sa vitakkaḥ sa vicāraḥ tat api samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Concentration with thinking and exploring is also a factor of awakening that leads to self-awakening, to direct knowledge, to self-awakening, to Unbinding.

original: Yadapi avitakko avicāro samādhi tadapi samādhisambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api a vitakkaḥ a vicāraḥ samādhi tat api samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Concentration without thinking and with only exploring is also a factor of awakening that leads to self-awakening, to direct knowledge, to self-awakening, to Unbinding.
“Herein, what is equanimity as a factor for awakening?

original: Atthi ajjhattaṁ dhammesu upekkhā, atthi bahiddhā dhammesu upekkhā.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattam dhammesu upekkhā atthi bahiddhā dhammesu upekkhā
translated: There is equanimity regarding mental qualities in oneself, and there is equanimity regarding mental qualities in others.

original: Yadapi ajjhattaṁ dhammesu upekkhā tadapi upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api ajjhattam dhammesu upekkhā tat api upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Equanimity regarding mental qualities in oneself is also a factor for awakening that leads to self-awakening, to direct knowledge, to self-awakening, to Unbinding.

original: Yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu upekkhā tadapi upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: yat api bahiddhā dhammesu upekkhā tat api upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: Equanimity regarding mental qualities in others is also a factor for awakening that leads to self-awakening, to direct knowledge, to self-awakening, to Unbinding.

“There are these seven factors for awakening:🔽mindfulness as a factor for awakening,🔽investigation of qualities as a factor for awakening,🔽energy as a factor for awakening,🔽rapture as a factor for awakening,🔽calm as a factor for awakening,🔽concentration as a factor for awakening,

original: satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo.
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: equanimity as a factor for awakening.
Herein, what is the factor of Complete Awakening that is Mindfulness?

original: Idha bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ,🔽dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhu sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmi  dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti pe
translated: Here, a monk develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, on dispassion, on cessation, which leads to relinquishment.🔽He develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Investigation of (the nature of) things …

analyzed: vīriya sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  pīti sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti
translated: He develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Energy …🔽He develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Rapture …

analyzed: passaddhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  samādhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Calm …🔽He develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Concentration …

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ.
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmi
translated: He develops the factor of Complete Awakening that is Equanimity, which relies on seclusion, on dispassion, on cessation, which leads to relinquishment.
The Basket of Discourses.
The Basket of Higher Teaching
There are seven factors of Awakening—

original: satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo.
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: the factor of Complete Awakening that is Mindfulness, the factor of Complete Awakening that is Investigation of (the nature of) things, the factor of Complete Awakening that is Energy, the factor of Complete Awakening that is Rapture, the factor of Complete Awakening that is Calm, the factor of Complete Awakening that is Concentration, the factor of Complete Awakening that is Equanimity.
Herein, what are the seven factors of Awakening?

original: Idha bhikkhu yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ🔽pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatāna  pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja
translated: Here, bhikkhus, when developing the supramundane jhana that leads to the penetration of the truths, which has the Deathless as its culmination and end, a bhikkhu enters upon and abides in the first jhana, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion,

original: viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye satta bojjhaṅgā honti—
analyzed: viharati dukkha paṭipadam tasmin samaye satta bojjhaṅgāḥ honti
translated: on that occasion the seven factors of enlightenment are present in him in an undeveloped state.

The enlightenment factor of mindfulness, the enlightenment factor of discrimination of phenomena, the enlightenment factor of energy, the enlightenment factor of rapture, the enlightenment factor of tranquillity, the enlightenment factor of concentration, and the enlightenment factor of equanimity.

original: Tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgo?🔽Yā sati anussati …pe… sammāsati satisambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṁ maggapariyāpannaṁ—
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo  yā sati anussati pe sammāsati sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpanna
translated: Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness?

That which is mindfulness, recollection, memory, the faculty of mindfulness, the power of mindfulness, right mindfulness, the road to power consisting in mindfulness, the foundation of mindfulness, the enlightenment factor of mindfulness—this is called the enlightenment factor of mindfulness.
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of discrimination of phenomena?

original: Yā paññā pajānanā …pe… amoho dhammavicayo sammādiṭṭhi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṁ maggapariyāpannaṁ—🔽ayaṁ vuccati “dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo”.🔽Tattha katamo vīriyasambojjhaṅgo?
analyzed: yā paññā pajānanā pe amohaḥ dhammavicayo sammādiṭṭhi dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpanna 🔽ayam vuccati dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgo 🔽tattha katamaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgo
translated: That which is wisdom, the faculty of wisdom, the power of wisdom, the sword of wisdom, the light of wisdom, the flame of wisdom, the burning of wisdom, the ferocity of wisdom, the energy of wisdom, the investigation of phenomena, the investigation of phenomena in phenomena, the right view of those who are rightly seeing, the faculty of wisdom, the power of wisdom, the sword of wisdom, the light of wisdom, the flame of wisdom, the burning of wisdom, the ferocity of wisdom, the energy of wisdom, the investigation of phenomena, the investigation of phenomena in phenomena, the right view of those who are rightly seeing, the wisdom that is the faculty of wisdom, the power of wisdom, the sword of wisdom, the light of wisdom, the flame of wisdom, the burning of wisdom, the ferocity of wisdom, the energy of wisdom, the investigation of phenomena, the investigation of phenomena in phenomena, the right view of those who are rightly seeing, the wisdom that is the faculty of wisdom, the power of wisdom, the sword of wisdom, the light of wisdom, the flame of wisdom, the burning of wisdom, the ferocity of wisdom, the energy of wisdom, the investigation of phenomena, the investigation of phenomena in phenomena, the right view of those who are rightly seeing, the wisdom that is the faculty of wisdom, the power of wisdom, the sword of wisdom, the light of wisdom, the flame of wisdom, the burning of wisdom, the ferocity

original: Yo cetasiko vīriyārambho …pe… sammāvāyāmo vīriyasambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṁ maggapariyāpannaṁ—
analyzed: yaḥ cetasikaḥ vīriya ārambhaḥ pe sammāvāyāmaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpanna
translated: It is whatever is bodily strength, strength of persistence, persistence, persistence of persistence, right persistence, the enlightenment factor of persistence, a path factor, included in the path.
This is said to be “the enlightenment factor of persistence.”
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of rapture?

original: Yā pīti pāmojjaṁ āmodanā pamodanā hāso pahāso vitti odagyaṁ attamanatā cittassa pītisambojjhaṅgo—
analyzed: yā pīti pāmojjam āmodanā pamodanā hāsaḥ pahāsaḥ vitti odagyam atta mana tā cittassa pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: It is whatever rapture, gladdening, gladness, extreme gladness, extreme gladdening, extreme gladdening of mind, rapture, elation, uplift of the mind, the enlightenment factor of rapture—
this is said to be “the enlightenment factor of rapture.”
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of calm?

original: Yā vedanākkhandhassa saññākkhandhassa saṅkhārakkhandhassa viññāṇakkhandhassa passaddhi paṭippassaddhi passambhanā paṭippassambhanā paṭippassambhitattaṁ passaddhisambojjhaṅgo—
analyzed: yā vedanā kkhandhassa saññā kkhandhassa saṅkhāra kkhandhassa viññāṇa kkhandhassa passaddhi paṭippassaddhi passambhanā paṭippassambhanā paṭippassambhi tattam passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: It is whatever calm, calmness, calm of body, calm of mind, calm of perceptions, calm of thoughts, calm of feelings, the enlightenment factor of calm—
this is said to be “the enlightenment factor of calm.”
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of concentration?

original: Yā cittassa ṭhiti …pe… sammāsamādhi samādhisambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṁ maggapariyāpannaṁ—
analyzed: yā cittassa ṭhiti pe sammāsamādhi samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpanna
translated: It is whatever steadying of the mind, steadying of consciousness, steadying on a single object, right concentration, the enlightenment factor of concentration, a path factor, included in the path.
This is said to be “the enlightenment factor of concentration.”
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of equanimity?

original: Yā upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā majjhattatā cittassa upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo—
analyzed: yā upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā majjhatta tā cittassa upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo
translated: Equanimity, being even-minded, neutrality, composure of awareness, the enlightenment factor of equanimity,
this is said to be “the enlightenment factor of equanimity”.
These are said to be the seven factors of enlightenment.
The remaining things are associated with the seven factors of enlightenment.
There are seven factors of enlightenment:
the enlightenment factor of mindfulness … the enlightenment factor of equanimity.
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness?

original: Idha bhikkhu yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ🔽pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja🔽viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, yā tasmiṁ samaye sati anussati sammāsati
analyzed: idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatāna  pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja  viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiñña yā tasmin samaye sati anussati sammā sati
translated: It is that at whatever time a monastic cultivates the path to power that possesses concentration due to desire and the volition of exertion, and so on as in the case of the four foundations of mindfulness.

At that time there is mindfulness, recollection, recollection that is memory, bearing in mind, remembering, the state of remembering, right mindfulness, the enlightenment factor of mindfulness that is of the nature of armour.
This is said to be “the enlightenment factor of mindfulness”.🔽The remaining things are associated with the enlightenment factor of mindfulness …

analyzed: avasesā dhammā sati sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe
translated: The remaining dhammas are associated with the factor of complete awakening that is mindfulness …

analyzed: avasesā dhammā dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe
translated: Other than those qualities associated with the factor of complete awakening that is investigation of (the nature and condition of) things …

original: avasesā dhammā vīriyasambojjhaṅgasampayuttā …pe…🔽avasesā dhammā pītisambojjhaṅgasampayuttā …pe…🔽avasesā dhammā passaddhisambojjhaṅgasampayuttā …pe…
analyzed: avasesā dhammā vīriya sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe  avasesā dhammā pīti sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe  avasesā dhammā passaddhi sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe
translated: Other than those qualities associated with the factor of complete awakening that is energy …🔽Other than those qualities associated with the factor of complete awakening that is rapture …🔽Other than those qualities associated with the factor of complete awakening that is calm …
Other than those qualities associated with the factor of complete awakening that is concentration.🔽Herein, what is the factor of complete awakening that is equanimity?

original: Tattha katamo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo?🔽Idha bhikkhu yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ🔽pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja🔽viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, yā tasmiṁ samaye upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā🔽majjhattatā cittassa upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo—🔽ayaṁ vuccati “upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo”.
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo  idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatāna  pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja  viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiñña yā tasmin samaye upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā  majjhatta tā cittassa upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo  ayam vuccati upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo
translated: It is equanimity, being even, evenness,

analyzed: avasesāḥ dhammāḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā 🔽satta bojjhaṅgā
translated: being even all around, being even all around internally, being even all around externally, being even all around internally and externally, being even all around in what is loved, being even all around in what is not loved, being even all around in what is loved and what is not loved, being even all around in the seen, being even all around in the heard, being even all around in the sensed, being even all around in the known, being even all around in the sensed and known, being even all around in the seen, heard, sensed, and known, being even all around in what is to be done, being even all around in what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in what is to be done and what is not to be done, being even all around in
the mindfulness factor of complete awakening … the equanimity factor of complete awakening.

original: Tattha katame satta bojjhaṅgā?🔽Idha bhikkhu yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ🔽pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: tattha katame satta bojjhaṅgā  idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatāna  pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja
translated: Herein, what are the seven factors of awakening?🔽On whatever occasion a monk develops the supermundane jhāna that leads to the destruction of the pollutants, to the relinquishment of the fetters,🔽having completely transcended the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, he enters & remains in the cessation of perception & feeling.

original: viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, yo tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti—
analyzed: viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiñña yaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti
translated: On that occasion there is contact, there is feeling, there is perception, there is intention, there is thought, there is wisdom, there is the mind-faculty, there is the life faculty.
These are wholesome thoughts.

original: Tasseva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa katattā bhāvitattā vipākaṁ vivicceva kāmehi
analyzed: tassa iva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa kata ttā bhāvita ttā vipākam vivicca iva kāmehi
translated: As a result of developing & pursuing that wholesome consciousness, he is a non-returner who, not returning to this world, is headed for a happy destination, headed for the deathless, headed for peace, headed for the right path, headed for enlightenment.🔽On whatever occasion a monk develops the supermundane jhāna that leads to the destruction of the pollutants, to the relinquishment of the fetters,

original: …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ suññataṁ,
analyzed: pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiññam suññata
translated: having completely transcended the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, he enters & remains in the cessation of perception & feeling.
On that occasion there are seven factors of awakening.

There is the mindfulness factor of complete awakening, the investigation of qualities factor of complete awakening, the energy factor of complete awakening, the rapture factor of complete awakening, the calm factor of complete awakening, the concentration factor of complete awakening, the equanimity factor of complete awakening.
Herein, what is the mindfulness factor of complete awakening?

original: Yā sati anussati …pe… sammāsati satisambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṁ maggapariyāpannaṁ—
analyzed: yā sati anussati pe sammāsati sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpanna
translated: It is any mindfulness, recollection, right mindfulness, mindfulness as a factor for Awakening, a path factor, that is included in the path.
This is called the factor for Awakening that is mindfulness.
Herein, what is the factor for Awakening that is equanimity?

original: Yā upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā majjhattatā cittassa upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo—
analyzed: yā upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā majjhatta tā cittassa upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo
translated: It is any equanimity, equanimity, looking on with equanimity, neutrality, balancedness of awareness, the factor for Awakening that is equanimity,
This is called the factor for Awakening that is equanimity.
These are called the seven factors for Awakening.
The remaining phenomena are associated with the seven factors for Awakening.
There are seven factors for Awakening:
the factor for Awakening that is mindfulness, … the factor for Awakening that is equanimity.

original: Tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgo?🔽Idha bhikkhu yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ🔽pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo  idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatāna  pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja
translated: Herein, what is the factor for Awakening that is mindfulness?🔽It is any time when a monk develops a supramundane absorption for the purpose of making an end of suffering, which is based on solitude, based on dispassion, based on cessation, resulting in letting go, and leads to complete Awakening.

original: viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti.
analyzed: viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiñña tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti
translated: On that occasion there is contact, there is feeling, there is perception, there is intention, there is thought, there is wisdom, there is mindfulness, there is thinking, there is reflection, there is resolve, there is zeal, there is initiative, there is energy, there is calm, there is the faculty of conviction, there is the faculty of persistence, there is the faculty of mindfulness, there is the faculty of concentration, there is the faculty of wisdom, there is the power of conviction, there is the power of persistence, there is the power of mindfulness, there is the power of concentration, there is the power of wisdom, there is the power of conscience, there is the power of shame, there is calm, there is the investigation faculty, there is the faculty of vigor, there is the faculty of not-clinging, there is right view, there is right thought, there is right speech, there is right action, there is right livelihood, there is right effort, there is right mindfulness, there is right concentration, there is the strength of virtue, there is the strength of concentration, there is the strength of wisdom, there is the strength of conscience, there is the strength of shame, there is no greed, there is no hate, there is no delusion, there is no stinginess, there is no hypocrisy, there is no conceit, there is no greed for sensual pleasures, there is no ill will, there is right view, there
These are wholesome thoughts.

original: Tasseva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa katattā bhāvitattā vipākaṁ vivicceva kāmehi🔽…pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, yā tasmiṁ
analyzed: tassa iva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa kata ttā bhāvita ttā vipākam vivicca iva kāmehi  pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiñña yā tasmi
translated: As a result of developing and repeatedly practicing that noble, wholesome jhāna,🔽… he attains the first jhāna.

original: samaye sati anussati sammāsati satisambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṁ maggapariyāpannaṁ—
analyzed: samaye sati anussati sammāsati sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpanna
translated: The mindfulness that there then is, the recollection, the mindfulness that one possesses, the mindfulness that has arisen, the true person’s faculty of mindfulness, the true person’s power of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the power of concentration, the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, the path factor of right mindfulness, the noble actuality of right mindfulness:

analyzed: ayam vuccati sati sambojjhaṅgo  avasesā dhammā sati sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe
translated: this is called the enlightenment factor of mindfulness.🔽The remaining thoughts are associated with the enlightenment factor of mindfulness. …

analyzed: avasesā dhammā dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe  avasesā dhammā vīriya sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe
translated: The remaining thoughts are associated with the enlightenment factor of investigation of (the nature of) things. …🔽The remaining thoughts are associated with the enlightenment factor of energy. …

analyzed: avasesā dhammā pīti sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe  avasesā dhammā passaddhi sambojjhaṅga sampayuttā pe
translated: The remaining thoughts are associated with the enlightenment factor of rapture. …🔽The remaining thoughts are associated with the enlightenment factor of calm. …
The remaining thoughts are associated with the enlightenment factor of concentration.
Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of equanimity?

original: Idha bhikkhu yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ
analyzed: idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatāna
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, when developing the supramundane jhana that leads to the penetration of the truths, which has the Deathless as its ground, the Deathless as its destination, the Deathless as its final goal, and which transcends the realms of the earth, the Deathless as its final goal, and which transcends the realms of the earth, the devas, and the human beings, being detached from sense desires…

original: pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: pahānāya paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja
translated: he enters and dwells in the first jhana…

original: viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti.
analyzed: viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiñña tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti
translated: At that time contact… and non-distraction are also present.

original: Ime dhammā kusalā.🔽Tasseva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa katattā bhāvitattā vipākaṁ vivicceva kāmehi🔽…pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati dukkhapaṭipadaṁ dandhābhiññaṁ suññataṁ,
analyzed: ime dhammā kusalā  tassa iva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa kata ttā bhāvita ttā vipākam vivicca iva kāmehi  pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiññam suññata
translated: These states are wholesome.🔽“As a result of undertaking and developing that same supramundane jhana that leads to the penetration of the truths, which has the Deathless as its ground, the Deathless as its destination, the Deathless as its final goal, and which transcends the realms of the earth, the devas, and the human beings, being detached from sense desires…🔽he enters and dwells in the first jhana…

original: yā tasmiṁ samaye upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā majjhattatā cittassa upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo—
analyzed: yā tasmin samaye upekkhā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā majjhatta tā cittassa upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo
translated: At that time equanimity, equanimity as a factor for awakening,
this is called the equanimity factor for awakening.
The remaining states are associated with the equanimity factor for awakening.
The Abhidhamma of the Baskets.
The Questioner
Seven factors of awakening:

original: satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo.🔽Sattannaṁ bojjhaṅgānaṁ kati kusalā, kati akusalā, kati abyākatā …pe… kati saraṇā, kati araṇā?🔽3.1. Tika🔽Siyā kusalā, siyā abyākatā.🔽Pītisambojjhaṅgo sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto;
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ  sattannam bojjhaṅgānam kati kusalā kati akusalā kati abyākatā pe kati saraṇā kati araṇā  tika  siyā kusalā siyā abyākatā  pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto
translated: the mindfulness factor of complete awakening, the investigation of (the nature and) characteristics of (phenomena) factor of complete awakening, the energy factor of complete awakening, the rapture factor of complete awakening, the calm factor of complete awakening, the concentration factor of complete awakening, the equanimity factor of complete awakening.

original: cha bojjhaṅgā siyā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttā, siyā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttā.🔽Siyā vipākā, siyā vipākadhammadhammā.🔽Anupādinnaanupādāniyā.🔽Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikā.🔽Siyā savitakkasavicārā, siyā avitakkavicāramattā, siyā avitakkaavicārā.🔽Pītisambojjhaṅgo na pītisahagato, sukhasahagato, na upekkhāsahagato;
analyzed: cha bojjhaṅgā siyā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttā siyā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttā 🔽siyā vipākā siyā vipāka dhamma dhammā 🔽an upādinna an upādāniyā 🔽asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikā 🔽siyā sa vitakka sa vicārā siyā a vitakka vicāra mattā siyā a vitakka a vicārā 🔽pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ na pīti sahagataḥ sukha sahagataḥ na upekkhā sahagataḥ
translated: Of the seven factors of awakening, how many are wholesome, how many are unwholesome, how many are indeterminate? … how many are connected with the sense sphere, how many are connected with the form sphere, how many are connected with the formless sphere? … how many are to be given up through vision (of the First Path), how many are to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths)? … how many are connected with joy, how many are connected with equanimity? … how many are to be given up through vision (of the First Path), how many are to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths), how many are not to be given up? … how many are associated with knowledge, how many are not associated with knowledge? … how many are with mental training, how many are without mental training, how many are neither with mental training nor without mental training? … how many are to be given up by vision (of the First Path), how many are to be given up by development (of the rest of the Paths), how many are not to be given up? … how many are supernormal powers, how many are not supernormal powers? … how many are wholesome roots, how many are unwholesome roots, how many are neither wholesome nor unwholesome roots? … how many are wholesome, how many are unwholesome, how many are indeterminate? … how many are with a root, how many are without a root? … how many are to be given up by vision (of the First Path), how many are to be given up by development (of the rest of the Paths), how many are not to be given up? … how many are a cause and also have a cause, how many are a cause but do not have a cause, how many do not have a cause and are not a cause? … how many are a primary element and also have a primary element, how many are a primary element but do not have a primary element, how many do not have a primary element and are not a primary element? … how many are a mental factor and also have mental factors, how many are a mental factor but do not have mental factors, how

original: cha bojjhaṅgā siyā pītisahagatā, siyā sukhasahagatā, siyā upekkhāsahagatā.
analyzed: cha bojjhaṅgā siyā pīti sahagatā siyā sukha sahagatā siyā upekkhā sahagatā
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment may be accompanied by happiness, may be accompanied by bliss, may be accompanied by equanimity.

analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā
translated: They are to be given up neither through vision nor through development.

original: Neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukā.🔽Siyā apacayagāmino, siyā nevācayagāmināpacayagāmino.
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukā  siyā apacaya gāmino siyā na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmino
translated: They have roots that are to be given up neither through vision nor through development.🔽They may lead to decrease, may lead to distinction, may lead neither to decrease nor to distinction.
They may be of a trainee, may be of one beyond training.
They are immeasurable.
They have immeasurable objects.
They are superior.
They may be connected with rightness, may be unconnected with rightness.

original: Na maggārammaṇā, siyā maggahetukā, siyā maggādhipatino;
analyzed: na magga ārammaṇā siyā magga hetukā siyā magga adhipatino
translated: They are not objects of the path. They may have roots that are objects of the path, they may have roots that are not objects of the path;

original: siyā na vattabbā “maggahetukā”tipi, “maggādhipatino”tipi.🔽Siyā uppannā, siyā anuppannā, siyā uppādino.
analyzed: siyā na vattabbā magga hetukā atipi magga adhipatino tipi  siyā uppannā siyā anuppannā siyā uppādinaḥ
translated: they may be roots that are objects of the path, they may not be roots that are objects of the path.🔽They may have arisen, may not have arisen, may be in the process of arising.

original: Siyā atītā, siyā anāgatā, siyā paccuppannā.
analyzed: siyā atītā siyā anāgatā siyā paccuppannā
translated: They may be past, may be future, may be present.

analyzed: na vattabbā atīta ārammaṇā atipi anāgata ārammaṇā atipi paccuppanna ārammaṇā atipi
translated: They are not to be said to be objects of the past, objects of the future, or objects of the present.

original: Siyā ajjhattā, siyā bahiddhā, siyā ajjhattabahiddhā.
analyzed: siyā ajjhattā siyā bahiddhā siyā ajjhatta bahiddhā
translated: They may be internal, may be external, may be both internal and external.
They have external objects.
They are non-perceptible and impinging.
The Dyads
3.2.1. The section on causes

analyzed: dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ hetu cha bojjhaṅgāḥ hetu sampayuttā
translated: The factor of complete awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things is a cause, the six factors of complete awakening are associated with a cause.

original: Dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo hetu ceva sahetuko ca, cha bojjhaṅgā na vattabbā “hetū ceva sahetukā cā”ti, sahetukā ceva na ca hetū.
analyzed: dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ hetu ca iva sa hetukaḥ ca cha bojjhaṅgā na vattabbā hetū ca iva sa hetukā ca ati sa hetukā ca iva na ca hetū
translated: The factor of complete awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things is a cause and is also caused, the six factors of complete awakening are not to be spoken of as a cause and are also caused, they are caused but are not a cause.

original: Dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo hetu ceva hetusampayutto ca, cha bojjhaṅgā na vattabbā “hetū ceva hetusampayuttā cā”ti, hetusampayuttā ceva na ca hetū.
analyzed: dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgo hetu ca iva hetu sampayutto ca cha bojjhaṅgā na vattabbā hetū ca iva hetu sampayuttā ca ati hetu sampayuttā ca iva na ca hetū
translated: The factor of complete awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things is a cause and is also associated with a cause, the six factors of complete awakening are not to be spoken of as a cause and are also associated with a cause, they are associated with a cause but are not a cause.

original: Cha bojjhaṅgā na hetū sahetukā, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo na vattabbo “na hetusahetuko”tipi, “na hetuahetuko”tipi.
analyzed: cha bojjhaṅgā na hetū sa hetukā dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ na vattabbaḥ na hetu sahetukā utipi na hetu ahetukā utipi
translated: The six factors of complete awakening are not a cause and are caused, the factor of complete awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things is not to be spoken of as not a cause and not caused, or as a cause and not caused.
... The small section on the internal🔽With conditions.
Conditioned.🔽Not visible.
Without resistance.
Without form.
Supramundane.
Cognizable by some, not cognizable by some.
... The section on the pollutants🔽Not pollutants.🔽Not associated with pollutants.
Not subject to cankers.

original: Na vattabbā “āsavā ceva sāsavā cā”tipi, sāsavā ceva no ca āsavātipi.
analyzed: na vattabbā āsavā ca iva sa āsavā ca atipi sa āsavā ca iva no ca
translated: They are not to be spoken of as both taints and associated with taints, and as associated with taints but not taints.

original: Na vattabbā “āsavā ceva āsavasampayuttā cā”tipi, “āsavasampayuttā ceva no ca āsavā”tipi.
analyzed: na vattabbā āsavā ca iva āsava sampayuttā ca atipi āsava sampayuttā ca iva no ca āsavā atipi
translated: They are not to be spoken of as both taints and conjoined with taints, and as conjoined with taints but not taints.
They are dissociated from taints.
They are untainted.

analyzed: sayojana gocchaka ādi  na u sayojanā pe
translated: The section on the range of the fetters, etc.🔽They are not fetters …🔽They are not bonds …
They are not bad ways …🔽They are not bad states …

analyzed: naḥ oghā pe  naḥ yogā pe  naḥ nīvaraṇā pe
translated: They are not hindrances …
They are not wrongnesses …
… The section on the great triad
They are objects.🔽They are not consciousness.

analyzed: citta sampayuttā  citta sasaṭṭhā  citta samuṭṭhānā  citta sahabhunaḥ
translated: They are mental factors.🔽They are associated with consciousness.🔽They are conjoined with consciousness.🔽They are originated by consciousness.

analyzed: citta anuparivattinaḥ  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānā  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna saha bhunaḥ
translated: They are conascent with consciousness.🔽They are coterminous with consciousness.🔽They are originated by what is conjoined with and originated by consciousness.
They are conascent with what is conjoined with and originated by consciousness.🔽They are coterminous with what is conjoined with and originated by consciousness.
They are external.
They are not clung to.
They are unclung to.

analyzed: upādāna gocchaka ādi  na u upādānā pe
translated: … The section on the range of the kinds of clinging, etc.🔽They are not kinds of clinging …

analyzed: no kilesā pe  na dassanena pahātabbā
translated: They are not defilements …🔽They are not to be given up by seeing.
They are not to be given up by keeping in being.
They are not causes that should be given up by seeing.

original: Na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukā.🔽Siyā savitakkā, siyā avitakkā.
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukā  siyā sa vitakkā siyā a vitakkā
translated: They are not to be given up through development.🔽They may be accompanied by thinking and exploring, or not.

original: Siyā savicārā, siyā avicārā.🔽Pītisambojjhaṅgo appītiko, cha bojjhaṅgā siyā sappītikā, siyā appītikā.
analyzed: siyā sa vicārā siyā avicārā  pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ appītiko cha bojjhaṅgā siyā sappītikā siyā appītikā
translated: They may be accompanied by rapture, or not.

original: Pītisambojjhaṅgo na pītisahagato, cha bojjhaṅgā siyā pītisahagatā, siyā na pītisahagatā.🔽Pītisambojjhaṅgo sukhasahagato, cha bojjhaṅgā siyā sukhasahagatā, siyā na sukhasahagatā.
analyzed: pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ na pīti sahagataḥ bojjhaṅgā siyā pīti sahagatā siyā na pīti sahagatā  pīti sambojjhaṅgo sukha sahagato bojjhaṅgā siyā sukha sahagatā siyā na sukha sahagatā
translated: The factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture is not accompanied by rapture; the other factors of Complete Awakening may be accompanied by rapture, or not.🔽The factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture is not accompanied by happiness; the other factors of Complete Awakening may be accompanied by happiness, or not.

original: Pītisambojjhaṅgo na upekkhāsahagato, cha bojjhaṅgā siyā upekkhāsahagatā, siyā na upekkhāsahagatā.
analyzed: pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ na upekkhā sahagataḥ cha bojjhaṅgā siyā upekkhā sahagatā siyā na upekkhā sahagatā
translated: The factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture is not accompanied by equanimity; the other factors of Complete Awakening may be accompanied by equanimity, or not.

analyzed: na kāma avacarā  na rūpa avacarā
translated: They are not of the sense-sphere.🔽They are not of the form-sphere.
They are not of the formless-sphere.

analyzed: a pariyāpannā  siyā niyyānikā siyā a niyyānikā
translated: They are not included.🔽They may be emancipations, or not.🔽They may be restricted, or not.
They are unsurpassed.🔽They are free from the pollutants.
